projectRoadmap.purpose: Links strategic goals to a tangible timeline and actionable tasks for A.I.D.A. voice-enabled AI assistant

priorityFramework.P0: Critical - Must be completed immediately (Voice interface, RAG pipeline, FERPA compliance)
priorityFramework.P1: High priority - Should be completed soon (Advanced features, district integration)
priorityFramework.P2: Medium priority - Can be completed later (Nice-to-have features, optimizations)

projectFoundation.missionStatement: Solve information overload for K-12 educators through voice-enabled AI assistant that provides instant access to district-specific information and personalized instructional feedback.
projectFoundation.visionStatement: Become the indispensable AI-powered command center for educators, transforming overwhelmed teachers into confident, efficient professionals through voice-first technology.
projectFoundation.corePhilosophy: Go deep, not wide - hyper-contextualization + voice interface for hands-free operation

phases.description: Build and demonstrate core voice assistant and instructional feedback capabilities
Validate product-market fit with early adopter teachers and refine based on feedback
Scale to full district-wide implementation with enterprise features and advanced analytics

currentStatus.keyAchievement: Project configuration and documentation framework completed
currentStatus.nextPhase: Phase 1: MVP Development - Begin hackathon preparation and core feature development

demographics.technology: Comfortable with basic technology, prefers simple, intuitive interfaces

secondaryPersonas.name: District Administrator (Michael)
secondaryPersonas.goals: Improve teacher efficiency, ensure policy compliance, demonstrate ROI
secondaryPersonas.frustrations: Teachers spending too much time on administrative tasks, lack of visibility into teacher needs
secondaryPersonas.quote: I need tools that actually solve real problems for our teachers, not just add to their workload.

secondaryPersonas.name: Curriculum Coordinator (Jennifer)
secondaryPersonas.goals: Ensure curriculum alignment, support teacher development, maintain quality standards
secondaryPersonas.frustrations: Teachers not following curriculum guidelines, lack of quick access to standards
secondaryPersonas.quote: Teachers need quick access to curriculum guidance without having to dig through multiple documents.

secondaryPersonas.name: New Teacher (David)
secondaryPersonas.goals: Learn district policies quickly, improve teaching effectiveness, gain confidence
secondaryPersonas.frustrations: Overwhelmed by policies and procedures, afraid to ask colleagues for help
secondaryPersonas.quote: I need help understanding what I'm supposed to do without bothering my colleagues constantly.

userJourneys.name: Voice District Policy Query
userJourneys.goal: Get instant answer to district policy question while multitasking
userJourneys.trigger: Teacher needs to know district policy on student-led projects
userJourneys.userActions: Activate voice interface, ask question, receive answer, ask follow-up if needed
userJourneys.projectResponse: Voice recognition, RAG search, AI response generation, voice synthesis, source citations

userJourneys.name: Lesson Plan Feedback
userJourneys.goal: Get AI-powered feedback to improve lesson plan engagement and rigor
userJourneys.trigger: Teacher uploads lesson plan for review
userJourneys.userActions: Upload lesson plan, review AI feedback, implement suggestions, track improvements
userJourneys.projectResponse: Document processing, AI analysis, feedback generation, improvement tracking

tier1.name: Free/Basic
tier1.features: Basic voice queries (5 per day), simple lesson plan feedback, limited document access

tier2.name: Teacher Pro ($50/month)
tier2.features: Unlimited voice queries, advanced lesson plan feedback, custom document ingestion, priority support

tier3.name: District Enterprise ($10,000/year)
tier3.features: All Teacher Pro features for all teachers, district-wide document management, advanced analytics, dedicated support

revenueModel.strategy: Freemium with Teacher Pro and District Enterprise tiers
revenueModel.targetConversion: 15% of free users upgrade to Pro within 90 days
revenueModel.arpuGoals: Teacher Pro: $50/month ARPU, District Enterprise: $10,000/year ARPU
revenueModel.growthStrategy: Start with individual teacher adoption, leverage success stories for district sales, expand through referrals

successMetrics.businessMetrics: MRR growth, conversion rate (15% free to Pro), churn rate (<5% monthly), ARPU ($50 teacher, $10K district)
successMetrics.engagementMetrics: Voice queries per session (5+), weekly active users (70%+), time to first voice interaction (24 hours)
successMetrics.technicalMetrics: Voice response time (<2s), recognition accuracy (>90%), uptime (99.9%), test coverage (>90%)

metricsByTier.freeTier: User activation (first voice query within 24 hours), feature adoption (lesson plan uploads), engagement depth
metricsByTier.paidTier: Usage depth (unlimited queries), retention (monthly churn <5%), feature utilization (advanced feedback)
metricsByTier.enterprise: District adoption rate, teacher satisfaction (>80%), renewal rate (>90%), ROI demonstration

roadmapPhases.goal: Build and demonstrate core voice assistant and instructional feedback capabilities for hackathon judges
keyDeliverables: Voice-enabled district assistant with Vapi integration
RAG pipeline with Firecrawl document ingestion
roadmapPhases.successMetrics: Voice interface functional, <2s response time, >90% recognition accuracy, successful hackathon demo

roadmapPhases.goal: Validate product-market fit with early adopter teachers and refine based on user feedback
keyDeliverables: Refined voice interface based on user feedback
Enhanced RAG accuracy and response quality
roadmapPhases.successMetrics: 10+ pilot teachers, >80% satisfaction rate, 5+ voice queries per session, 70% weekly active usage

roadmapPhases.goal: Scale to full district-wide implementation with enterprise features and advanced analytics
roadmapPhases.successMetrics: First district contract, 100+ teachers per district, >90% renewal rate, $10K+ ARPU per district

taskBacklog.description: Prioritized list of all tasks for A.I.D.A. development, from hackathon to district rollout

tasks.description: Set up Convex backend with authentication and database schema
Integrate Vapi voice interface with React frontend
tasks.notes: Critical for hackathon demo, target <2s response time

tasks.description: Implement RAG pipeline with Firecrawl document ingestion
tasks.notes: Core differentiator, must support district-specific queries

tasks.description: Build AI lesson plan feedback system with OpenAI integration
tasks.notes: Key MVP feature, focus on engagement and rigor improvements

tasks.description: Create responsive dashboard with Voice Orb design
tasks.notes: Use shadcn/ui + react-bits + tweakcn integration strategy

tasks.description: Implement FERPA compliance and audit logging
tasks.notes: Critical for education market, reference security_compliance in AIDA_CONFIG.yaml

tasks.description: Set up environment variables and deployment configuration
tasks.notes: Vercel frontend, Convex Cloud backend, environment secrets

tasks.description: Create teacher onboarding flow and documentation
tasks.notes: Focus on first voice query within 24 hours activation
ROI demonstration, usage analytics, teacher satisfaction metrics

tasks.description: Implement advanced voice interface features (empathy bar, emotional detection)

currentSprint.description: Hackathon preparation tasks - core MVP features

tasks.description: Set up project repository and development environment
tasks.notes: React + Vite + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS setup

tasks.description: Configure Convex backend with basic schema
tasks.notes: Start with users, documents, and chatMessages tables

blockedTasks.description: Tasks blocked by external dependencies or technical constraints

tasks.reasonBlocked: Awaiting Vapi API key and webhook configuration
Awaiting OpenAI API key and model access

riskAssessment.risk: Voice recognition accuracy below 90% in classroom environments
riskAssessment.mitigation: Implement noise cancellation, test in real classroom settings, provide fallback text input option
Optimize vector search, implement caching, use smaller document chunks, consider response streaming

riskAssessment.risk: FERPA compliance issues with voice data processing
riskAssessment.mitigation: Ensure all processing within Convex deployment, implement audit logging, regular compliance reviews

riskAssessment.risk: Low teacher adoption due to voice interface unfamiliarity
riskAssessment.mitigation: Comprehensive onboarding, clear value demonstration, gradual feature introduction, excellent documentation

riskAssessment.risk: Competition from established education technology companies
riskAssessment.mitigation: Focus on voice-first differentiation, district-specific contextualization, FERPA compliance advantage

competitiveAnalysis.directCompetitors: Khanmigo (free lesson planning, no voice interface), MagicSchool AI (50+ tools, no voice), Brisk Teaching (Google integration, limited scope), TeacherMatic (comprehensive tools, no voice)
competitiveAnalysis.indirectCompetitors: Google Classroom (massive user base, not voice-first), Microsoft Education (enterprise focus, no AI voice), Canvas LMS (learning management, no voice AI)
competitiveAnalysis.competitiveAdvantage: Voice-first interface with district-specific contextualization and FERPA-compliant architecture - unique combination in education market
keyDifferentiators: Integrated lesson plan feedback and policy queries

coreAssumptions: Teachers will adopt voice interfaces for hands-free operation
District administrators will pay for tools that improve teacher efficiency
Voice recognition accuracy will be sufficient in classroom environments
FERPA compliance is a key differentiator in education market
Teachers prefer district-specific information over generic AI responses
constraints: Limited budget for external API costs during development
FERPA compliance requirements limit third-party integrations
Voice interface must work on mobile devices (primary teacher device)
Must demonstrate clear ROI for district administrators

featurePrioritization.description: Clarifies which features are in and out of scope for each version, preventing scope creep and ensuring focused effort

features.name: Voice District Assistant
features.description: Core voice interface for district policy and curriculum queries
features.notes: Critical for hackathon demo, must achieve <2s response time

features.name: AI Lesson Plan Feedback
features.description: AI-powered feedback on lesson plans for engagement and rigor
features.notes: Key differentiator, demonstrates AI value proposition

features.name: Teacher Dashboard
features.description: Command center with voice interface and recent interactions
features.notes: Central hub for all teacher activities, mobile-optimized

features.name: RAG Pipeline
features.description: Document ingestion and semantic search for district-specific information

features.name: FERPA Compliance
features.description: Audit logging, data retention, and security compliance
features.notes: Required for education market, competitive advantage

features.name: District Analytics
features.description: Usage analytics and reporting for administrators
features.notes: Important for district sales and ROI demonstration

features.name: Advanced Voice Features
features.description: Empathy bar, emotional detection, advanced voice interactions

features.name: Mobile App
features.description: Native mobile application for voice interface
features.notes: Enhancement after web app success, not critical for MVP

minorReleases.focus: Bug fixes, performance improvements, small feature additions

majorReleases.focus: Major new features, significant UI updates, new integrations

hotfixes.frequency: Deployed as needed for critical bugs

keyFeatures: Voice-enabled district assistant with Vapi integration
Basic teacher dashboard with Voice Orb
Enhanced voice interface with improved accuracy

changeManagementGovernance.description: Formalizes the process of updating this document to ensure it remains a single source of truth for A.I.D.A. project planning

updateReviewProcess.description: Team member identifies required change to project roadmap. Draft proposal referencing specific sections and rationale.
Proposal reviewed by Product Manager, System Architect, and relevant team leads based on impact scope.
Upon approval, maintainer updates document with change, updates Last Updated date, and documents change in changelog.
Change communicated to entire team via Slack/email, with focus on impact to current sprint and upcoming milestones.

versioningHistory: Major Updates: Increment version number and document changes in dedicated changelog
Ownership: Product Manager owns roadmap, System Architect owns technical sections
Review Cycle: Weekly during active development, monthly during pilot phase
